item.title: Stochastic limits, part 2: tails, memory, and the Joseph and Noah effects
item.description: In the last post, we discussed what happens to the sum \[\begin{equation} \lim_{N\to\infty} S_N - \mu N, \qquad S_N := \sum_{i=1}^{N} X_i, \end{equation}\] with \(X_i\) drawn from some “nice” distribution with \(\mu := \mathbb{E}[X_i]\). In this scenario, \(\mathbf{S}_N(t) \to \mathbf{B}(t)\), Brownian motion. For this discussion, we’ll have to state a little more explicitly what we mean by “nice.” The two big features we needed are finite (first two) moments, i.
